snippet: Loans are still tight, consumers are timid, and the action — or lack of it — in Washington has heightened pessimism among small-business owners.
abstract: Small business owners report unbridled pessimism about economy, saying loans are still tight, consumers are cautious on spending, and taxes and government regulation are biggest impediments to growth; small-business optimism index is at fourth-lowest reading in nearly 40 years.
lead_paragraph: Loans are still tight, consumers are timid, and the action — or lack of it — in Washington has heightened pessimism among small-business owners.

headline.seo: Small Businesses Struggle, Impeding a Recovery
headline.main: Small Businesses Still Struggle, and That’s Impeding a Recovery
headline.print_headline: Small Businesses Still Struggle, and That’s Impeding a Recovery
